doc.name: $_SERVER
doc.summary: $_SERVER is an array variable containing the CGI interface related variables, along with any HTTP_* variables that are available.

description.overview:
Use the $_SERVER keyword to access the CGI interface related variables, along with any HTTP_* variables that are available.
$_SERVER is only available when running in CGI mode (Server).
description.comments:
The list of CGI variables is:
GATEWAY_INTERFACE
SERVER_ADDR
SERVER_NAME
SERVER_SOFTWARE
SERVER_PROTOCOL
REQUEST_METHOD
REQUEST_TIME
QUERY_STRING
DOCUMENT_ROOT
HTTPS
REMOTE_USER
REDIRECT_REMOTE_USER
REMOTE_ADDR
REMOTE_HOST
REMOTE_PORT
SERVER_ADMIN
SERVER_PORT
SERVER_SIGNATURE
PATH_TRANSLATED
REQUEST_URI
PATH_INFO
SCRIPT_NAME
SCRIPT_FILENAME
CONTENT_TYPE
CONTENT_LENGTH
$_SERVER can be modified doing so has no effect and should be avoided (indeed, it might become read-only in future).
